label: familial isolated dilated cardiomyopathy
definition: A rare familial cardiomyopathy characterized by the dilation of left ventricle and progressively impairing of systolic ventricular function, in the absence of abnormal loading conditions or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. The disease may cause heart failure or arrhythmia. The disease is isolated when no additional atypical cardiac or extracardiac manifestations are present.

label: variable-age onset idiopathic generalized epilepsy syndrome
definition: Any idiopathic generalized epilepsy syndrome that has a variable-age onset.

label: neonatal/infantile-onset self-limited epilepsy syndrome
definition: An epilepsy syndrome characterized by the onset of seizures in neonates/infants where there is a high likelihood of spontaneously remitting at a predictable age.

label: genetic epilepsy with febrile seizures plus spectrum
definition: A neonatal/infantile-onset self-limited familial syndrome characterized by the presence of febrile seizures in an individual with a family history of seizures/epilepsy. Febrile seizures may be typical febrile seizures or 'febrile seizures plus' (FS+) may occur, where febrile seizures continue past 6 years of age and/or are accompanied by afebrile seizures which may be generalized or focal. FS+ and GEFS+ are distinguished on the basis of family history. A number of dominantly inherited genes have been linked to both GEFS+ and FS+, with implications for specific genetic counselling, due to the variable severity of the epilepsy in different family members. Although febrile seizures are the hallmark of this familial syndrome, not all individuals in a family may have these.

label: neonatal/infantile-onset epilepsy syndrome with developmental and epileptic encephalopathy
definition: A neonatal/infantile epilepsy syndrome characterized by the onset of non-self-limiting seizures and developmental regression or delay in infants/neonates. This condition is typically caused by genetic mutations that disrupt normal brain development, affecting both cognitive and motor development that is not responsive to typical seizure treatments.

label: early-infantile DEE
definition: A neonatal/infantile epilepsy syndrome characterized by frequent drug-resistant seizures that begin ≤3 months of age, with abnormal interictal EEG and neurological examination.

label: variable-age onset focal epilepsy syndrome
definition: An epilepsy syndrome characterized by focal seizures where age at seizure onset varies.

label: familial mesial temporal lobe epilepsy
definition: A focal epilepsy syndrome where the age at onset is typically in adolescence or adulthood. Affected individuals have focal aware seizures with mesial temporal lobe features, especially prominent déjà vu. Most patients have a normal MRI, and seizures respond to treatment. A subgroup is recognised that have antecedent febrile seizures, hippocampal atrophy, and drug resistant seizures. Direct questioning of relatives may be required to identify this familial epilepsy syndrome, as many individuals consider their déjà vu experiences as mild and they may not have been diagnosed as seizures.

label: variable-age onset combined generalized and focal epilepsy syndrome
definition: An epilepsy syndrome characterized by a combined generalized and focal epilepsy syndromes where age at seizure onset varies.

label: variable-age epilepsy syndrome with developmental and/or epileptic encephalopathy or progressive neurological deterioration
definition: An epilepsy syndrome characterized by seizures along with developmental and/or epileptic encephalopathy or progressive neurological deterioration where age at seizure onset varies.

label: epilepsy with auditory features
definition: A variable-age onset focal epilepsy syndrome with characteristic focal aware sensory auditory seizures. Seizures often produce such mild symptoms that they are not diagnosed. There are no implications expected for development or learning and seizures are typically infrequent and well controlled. EAF may occur as a familial syndrome, familial EAF (FEAF, previous known as autosomal dominant lateral temporal lobe epilepsy or autosomal dominant partial epilepsy with auditory features). Inheritance may be autosomal dominant (ADEAF), with incomplete penetrance.

label: childhood-onset genetic generalized epilepsy syndrome
definition: A genetic generalized epilepsy that has an onset during childhood.

label: childhood-onset idiopathic generalized epilepsy syndrome
definition: An idiopathic generalized epilepsy that has an onset during childhood.

label: childhood-onset epilepsy syndrome with developmental and/or epileptic encephalopathy
definition: A childhood-onset epilepsy syndrome where the onset of the condition includes manifestations of cognitive, neurological, or psychiatric impairment, stagnation, or regression, due directly to the underlying etiology. In contrast, an epileptic encephalopathy (EE) is present when the encephalopathy is caused by the epileptic activity. The term developmental and epileptic encephalopathy (DEE) is used when both factors contribute to the patient’s condition.

label: developmental and/or epileptic encephalopathy with spike-wave activation in sleep
definition: A spectrum of conditions with varied degree of cognitive, language, behavioral, and motor regression associated with marked spike-wave activation in sleep. The regression is seen within weeks of the EEG pattern. This syndrome encompasses the previous syndromes epileptic encephalopathy with continuous spike-wave in sleep and atypical childhood epilepsy with centrotemporal spikes (also previously known as pseudo-Lennox syndrome and atypical benign partial epilepsy). Landau–Kleffner syndrome is a specific subtype of EE-SWAS, where regression affects mainly language, with an acquired auditory agnosia.

label: childhood-onset self-limited focal epilepsy syndrome
definition: A group of conditions characterized by age-dependent occurrence in otherwise normal children. Cognition and neurological evaluation are typically normal. Remission occurs in almost all patients by puberty. Presumed genetic factors have an important role. Seizure semiology and electroencephalographic (EEG) features are specific for each of the syndromes included in this group.

label: TMEM63B-related developmental and epileptic encephalopathy with anemia
definition: A developmental and epileptic encephalopathy caused by variation in the TMEM63B gene. This disorder is characterised by early-onset drug-resistant epilepsy, with moderate-to-profound intellectual disability, severe motor impairment and brain structural anomalies. Most patients present early generalised hypotonia, nystagmus and central visual impairment, severe dysphagia and haematological abnormalities.

label: TFAP2B-related congenital heart disease spectrum disorder
definition: Any congenital heart disease caused by pathogenic variation(s) in the TFAP2B gene, which encodes the transcription factor AP-2β. This disorder is characterized by patent ductus arteriosus, facial dysmorphism and hand anomalies. Additional features include sensorineural hearing loss, scoliosis, dental anomalies, and central diabetes insipidus. Given the spectrum of symptoms associated with this condition, patients may exhibit a combination of these features. The underlying mechanism of the spectrum disorder is both dominant negative and loss-of-function. Pathogenic missense variants reported in Char syndrome patients appear to be dominant negative while loss-of-function alleles in PDA patients are likely to act through haploinsufficiency.

label: neonatal cerebellar ataxia, GRM1-related, dog
definition: Any cerebellar ataxia that occurs dogs due to a mutation in the GRM1 gene.

label: glycogen storage disease IV, dog
definition: Any glycogen storage disease that occurs in dogs due to a glycogen branching enzyme (GBE) deficiency.

label: glycogen storage disease IV, domestic cat
definition: Any glycogen storage disease that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the GBE1 gene.

label: glycogen storage disease IV, horse
definition: Any glycogen storage disease that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the GBE1 gene.

label: fasting unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, Bolivian squirrel monkey
definition: Any unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia due to an increase in the bilirubin turnover/production rate and/or decreased hepatic conjugation during fasting that occurs in Bolivian squirrel monkey.

label: unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia, horse
definition: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia that occurs in horses.

label: conjugated hyperbilirubinemia, sheep
definition: A liver disorder characterized by chronic conjugated hyperbilirubinemia and gross dark brown to black discoloration of the liver that occurs in sheep.

label: conjugated hyperbilirubinemia, golden lion tamarin
definition: A liver disorder characterized by chronic conjugated hyperbilirubinemia and abundant intrahepatic pigment in a centrilobular and midzonal distribution that occurs in golden lion tamarins.

label: intestinal cobalamin (vitamin B12) malabsorption, AMN-related, dog
definition: Intestinal cobalamin (vitamin B12) malabsorption that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the AMN gene.

label: membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis, CFH-related, pig
definition: Form of glomerulonephritis that occurs in pigs, is characterized by glomerular hypercellularity and thickening of the glomerular capillary walls and glomerular basement membrane due to large amounts of dense deposits, and is caused by an absence of omplement regulator factor H.

label: mesangiocapillary glomerulonephritis, type I, sheep
definition: A form of glomerulonephritis that occurs in sheep and is characterized by thickening of glomerular capillary basement membranes, proliferation of mesangial cells, and peri-glomerular fibrosis and associated with C3 deficiency.

label: microphthalmia-4, chicken
definition: Inherited microphthalmia that occurs in female chickens.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis I, dog
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the IDUA gene.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis I, domestic cat
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the IDUA gene.

label: X-linked canine shaking pup, PLP1-related, dog
definition: Any X-linked tremor that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PLP1 gene.

label: X-linked paralytic tremor, PLP1-related, rabbit
definition: Any X-linked tremor that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the PLP1 gene.

label: progressive degenerative myeloencephalopathy, PNPLA8-related, dog
definition: Any progressive degenerative myeloencephalopathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PNPLA8 gene.

label: progressive degenerative myeloencephalopathy, PNPLA8-related, cattle
definition: Any progressive degenerative myeloencephalopathy that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the PNPLA8 gene.

label: X-linked progressive retinal atrophy 1, RPGR-related, dog
definition: X-linked form of progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RPGR gene and is characterized by normal photoreceptor morphogenesis, after which progressive rod–cone degeneration develops in the peripheral retina, gradually advancing toward the optic disc.

label: rod-cone dysplasia 1, PDE6B-related, dog
definition: Any rod-cone dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PDE6B gene.

label: XX difference of sexual development, common carp
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in common carp and is characterized by male sex reversal in gynogenetic females with XX karyotype.

label: XX difference of sexual development, Japanese medaka
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in Japanese medaka and is characterized by male sex reversal with female karyotype (XX).

label: XX difference of sexual development, dog
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in dogs and is characterized by the presence of testicular tissue in the gonads and varying degrees of phenotypic masculinization with a female karyotype (XX) and absence of both the SRY gene and the Y chromosome.

label: XX difference of sexual development, domestic cat
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in domestic cats and is characterized by the presence of testicular tissue in the gonads with a female karyotype (XX) and absence of the SRY gene.

label: XX difference of sexual development, horse
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in horses and is characterized by testicular tissue in the gonads, varying levels of masculinization, a female karyotype (XX), and the absence of the SRY gene.

label: XX difference of sexual development, pig
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in pigs and is characterized by male sex reversal with female karyotype (XX) and absence of the SRY gene.

label: XX difference of sexual development, llama
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in llamas and is characterized by male sex reversal with female karyotype (XX) and absence of the SRY gene.

label: XX difference of sexual development, goat
definition: Any difference of sexual differentiation that occurs in goats and is characterized by the presence of testicular tissue in the gonads, abscence of horns (polled), with a female karyotype (XX) and absence of the SRY gene.

label: von Willebrand disease I, dog
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in dogs and is characterized by low plasma vWF concentrations and mild to moderate bleeding symptoms due to a mutation in the VWF gene.

label: von Willebrand disease I, pig
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in pigs and is characterized by low plasma vWF concentrations and mild to moderate bleeding symptoms.

label: von Willebrand disease III, dog
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in dogs and is characterized by no detectable or a severe quantitative deficiency of the glycoprotein von Willebrand factor (vWF) due to a mutation in the VWF gene.

label: von Willebrand disease III, domestic cat
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in cats and is characterized by no detectable or a severe quantitative deficiency of the glycoprotein von Willebrand factor (vWF).

label: von Willebrand disease III, pig
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in pigs and is characterized by no detectable or a severe quantitative deficiency of the glycoprotein von Willebrand factor (vWF) due to a mutation in the VWF gene.

label: nephritis, COL4A5-related, dog
definition: Nephritis that occurs in male dogs due to a mutation in the COL4A5 gene.

label: autosomal dominant nephritis, dog
definition: Autosomal dominant form of nephritis that occurs in dogs.

label: polysaccharide storage myopathy, type 1, horse
definition: Any disorder of glycogen metabolism that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the GYS1 gene.

label: autoimmune polyendocrinopathy, dog
definition: Any primary hypothyroidism and primary cortisol-deficient hypoadrenocorticism with increased serum concentrations of thyroglobulin autoantibodies and 21-hydroxylase autoantibodies that occurs in dogs.

label: osteochondromatosis, EXT2-related, dog
definition: Any osteochondromatosis that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the EXT2 gene.

label: XY sex reversal, SRY-related, horse
definition: Any disorder of sexual differentiation that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the SRY gene.

label: XY sex reversal, SRY-related, Western roe deer
definition: Any disorder of sexual differentiation that occurs in Western roe deer due to a mutation in the SRY gene.

label: XY sex reversal, SRY-related, cattle
definition: Any disorder of sexual differentiation that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the SRY gene.

label: XY sex reversal, SRY-related, rabbit
definition: Any disorder of sexual differentiation that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the SRY gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: retinal degeneration, CEP290-related, domestic cat
definition: Any retinal degeneration that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the CEP290 gene.

label: retinal degeneration, GC1-related, chicken
definition: Any retinal degeneration that occurs in chickens due to a mutation in the GC1 gene.

label: mucolipidosis, GNPTAB-related, domestic cat
definition: Mucolipidosis that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the GNPTAB gene.

label: rod-cone dysplasia 2, RD3-related, dog
definition: Any rod-cone dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RD3 gene.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis II, Kaka
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder characterized by deficient iduronate-2-sulfatase (IDS) activity that occurs in kakas.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis II, dog
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder characterized by deficient iduronate-2-sulfatase (IDS) activity that occurs in dogs.

label: hereditary footpad hyperkeratosis, FAM83G-related, dog
definition: An orthokeratotic palmoplantar hyperkeratosis leading to thickened and hardened footpads that occurs in dogs starting at an age of 18 to 24 weeks of age due to a mutation in the FAM83G gene.

label: von Willebrand disease II, dog
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in dogs and is characterized by qualitative abnormalities of the glycoprotein von Willebrand factor (vWF) and moderate to severe bleeding due to a mutation in the VWF gene.

label: von Willebrand disease II, horse
definition: Any von Willebrand disease that occurs in horses and is characterized by qualitative abnormalities of the glycoprotein von Willebrand factor (vWF) and moderate to severe bleeding.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis IIIB, emu
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder that occurs in emu due to a mutation in the NAGLU gene.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis IIIB, dog
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the NAGLU gene.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis IIIB, pig
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the NAGLU gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: mucopolysaccharidosis IIIB, cattle
definition: Any lysosomal storage disorder that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the NAGLU gene.

label: autosomal dominant progressive retinal atrophy, RHO-related, dog
definition: Autosomal dominant form of progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RHO gene.

label: Waardenburg syndrome, MITF-related, golden hamster
definition: Any Waardenburg syndrome that occurs in golden hamsters due to a mutation in the MITF gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: Waardenburg syndrome, MITF-related, pig
definition: Any Waardenburg syndrome that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the MITF gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: hereditary vitamin D-resistant rickets, VDR-related, dog
definition: Any inherited rickets that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the VDR gene.

label: vitamin D-dependent rickets, VDR-related, cat
definition: Any inherited rickets that occurs in domestic cats due to a mutation in the VDR gene.

label: cone-rod dystrophy, RPGRIP1-related and MAP9-related, dog
definition: Any cone-rod dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to mutations in the RPGRIP1 and MAP9 genes.

label: multifocal retinopathy 1, BEST1-related, dog
definition: Any retinal disorder characterized by multiple areas of retinal degeneration that occurs in dogs due to a C(73)T stop mutation in the BEST1 gene.

label: spondylo-epiphyseal dysplasia tarda, X-linked, dog
definition: Any X-linked chondrodysplasia characterized by spondylosis and arthrosis that occurs in dogs.

label: canine multiple system degeneration, SERAC1-related, dog
definition: A progressive hereditary neurodegenerative disorder that occurs in dogs and is characterized by neuronal degeneration and loss in the cerebellum, olivary nuclei, substantia nigra, and caudate nuclei due to a mutation in the SERAC1 gene.

label: melanoma-bearing Libechov minipig, pig
definition: Hereditary melanoma that occurs in melanoma-bearing Libechov minipipgs due to selective breeding for the purpose of creating a swine model of hereditary metastatic melanoma.

label: multifocal symmetrical necrotizing encephalomyelopathy, Angus cattle
definition: A necrotizing encephalomyelopathy that occurs in calves of the Angus breed of cattle and is characterized by symmetrical degenerative lesions in the brain and spinal cord.

label: demyelinating disorder, Limousin cattle
definition: Any demyelinating disease that occurs in calves of the Limousin breed of cattle and is characterized by progressively severe forelimb hypermetria, blindness, behavioural abnormalities and multifocal white matter vacuolation and demyelination.

label: multifocal symmetrical necrotizing encephalomyelopathy, Simmental cattle
definition: Any necrotising myelopathy that occurs in calves of the Simmental breed of cattle and is characterized by progressive hindlimb ataxia and paralysis and bilateral symmetrical foci of necrosis throughout the grey matter of the brain.

label: lysosomal storage disease, ARSG related, dog
definition: Any lysosomal storage disease that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ARSG gene.

label: X-linked progressive retinal atrophy, type 3, dog
definition: X-linked form of progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs.

label: X-linked progressive retinal atrophy 2, RPGR-related, dog
definition: X-linked form of progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RPGR gene and is characterized by severe manifestation during early retinal development.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, CCDC66 related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the CCDC66 gene.

label: oculoskeletal dysplasia, COL9A3-related, dog
definition: Any retinal and skeletal dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the COL9A3 gene.

label: oculoskeletal dysplasia, COL9A2-related, dog
definition: Any retinal and skeletal dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the COL9A2 gene.

label: neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis, ATP13A2-related, dog
definition: Any neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ATP13A2 gene.

label: multifocal retinopathy 2, BEST1-related, dog
definition: Any retinal disorder characterized by multiple areas of retinal degeneration that occurs in dogs due to a G(482)A missense mutation in the BEST1 gene.

label: multifocal retinopathy 3, BEST1-related, dog
definition: Any retinal disorder characterized by multiple areas of retinal degeneration that occurs in dogs due to a variant in exon 10 of the BEST1 gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, SLC4A3-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SLC4A3 gene.

label: immunodeficiency syndrome, SLC5A3-related, horse
definition: Immunodeficiency characterized by B-lymphocyte lymphopenia and progressive anemia that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the SLC5A3 gene.

label: ichthyosis, PNPLA1-related, dog
definition: Ichthyosis that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PNPLA1 gene.

label: XY difference of sexual development, dog
definition: Any difference of sexual development that occurs in dogs with a XY karyotype.

label: XY difference of sexual development, domestic cat
definition: Any difference of sexual development that occurs in domestic cats with a XY karyotype.

label: XY difference of sexual development, horse
definition: Any difference of sexual development that occurs in horses with a XY karyotype.

label: early-onset retinal dystrophy, Bengal, domestic cat
definition: Any retinal dystrophy that occurs in the Bengal breed of domestic cats characterized as early-onset primary photoreceptor disorder that leads to blindness within the ﬁrst year of age.

label: muscular dystrophy with reduced β-sarcoglycan, domestic cat
definition: Any muscular dystrophy associated with β-sarcoglycan deficiency that occurs in cats.

label: rod-cone dysplasia 1a, PDE6B-related, dog
definition: Any rod-cone dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to an 8-bp insertion in exon 21 in the PDE6B gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, LAMA3-related, dog
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the LAMA3 gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, LAMA3-related, horse
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the LAMA3 gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, LAMA3-related, cattle
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the LAMA3 gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, LAMC2-related, horse
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in horses due to a mutation in the LAMC2 gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, LAMC2-related, cattle
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the LAMC2 gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, LAMC2-related, sheep
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the LAMC2 gene.

label: porcine stress syndrome, DMD-related, pig
definition: Any cardiomyopathy characterized by death under stressful conditions that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the DMD gene.

label: hemifacial microsomia, domestic cat
definition: Any congenital malformation syndrome presenting with unilateral craniofacial abnormalities that occurs in cats.

label: difference of sexual development, DMRT1-related, Japanese medaka
definition: Any difference of sexual development that occurs in Japanese medaka due to a mutation in the DMRT1 gene.

label: Waardenburg syndrome, EDNRB-related, sheep
definition: Any Waardenburg syndrome that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the EDNRB gene.

label: Y anomaly in low reproductive females, cattle
definition: Any reproductive system disorder that occurs in female cattle and is characterized by decreased reproductive efficiency and the presence of Y chromosome segments.

label: skeletal dysplasia, COL11A2-related, dog
definition: Any skeletal dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the COL11A2 gene.

label: intestinal cobalamin (vitamin B12) malabsorption, CUBN-related, dog
definition: Intestinal cobalamin (vitamin B12) malabsorption that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the CUBN gene.

label: xanthinuria, type II, dog
definition: Any xanthinuria that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the MOCOS gene.

label: xanthinuria, MOCOS-related, cattle
definition: Any xanthinuria that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the MOCOS gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, SAG-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the SAG gene.

label: polyneuropathy, ARHGEF10-related, dog
definition: Any polyneuropathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ARHGEF10 gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, FAM161A-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the FAM161A gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, MERTK-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the MERTK gene.

label: ptosis, intellectual disability, retarded growth and mortality syndrome, UBE3B-related, cattle
definition: Any syndromic disease that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the UBE3B gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, ITGB4-related, cattle
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the ITGB4 gene.

label: junctional epidermolysis bullosa, ITGB4-related, sheep
definition: Junctional epidermolysis bullosa that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the ITGB4 gene.

label: muscular dystrophy, COL6A1-related, dog
definition: Any muscular dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the COL6A1 gene.

label: polyneuropathy, RAB3GAP1-related, dog
definition: Any polyneuropathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RAB3GAP1 gene.

label: neuroaxonal dystrophy, TECPR2-related, dog
definition: Any neuroaxonal dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the TECPR2 gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, CNGA1-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the CNGA1 gene.

label: atherosclerosis, APOE-related, rabbit
definition: Atherosclerosis that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the APOE gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, Whippet, dog
definition: Progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in the Whippet breed of dog.

label: ichthyosis, ASPRV1-related, dog
definition: Ichthyosis that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ASPRV1 gene.

label: neuroaxonal dystrophy, PLA2G6-related, dog
definition: Any neuroaxonal dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the PLA2G6 gene.

label: neuroaxonal dystrophy, PLA2G6-related, sheep
definition: Any neuroaxonal dystrophy that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the PLA2G6 gene.

label: osteogenesis imperfecta, COL1A2-related, dog
definition: Any osteogenesis imperfecta that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the COL1A2 gene.

label: hypotrichosis, KRT71-related, cattle
definition: Congenital hypotrichosis that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the KRT71 gene.

label: polyneuropathy, GJA9-related, dog
definition: Any polyneuropathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the GJA9 gene.

label: polyneuropathy, NDRG1-related, dog
definition: Any polyneuropathy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the NDRG1 gene.

label: osteogenesis imperfecta, type III, COL1A1-related, dog
definition: Any osteogenesis imperfecta that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the COL1A1 gene.

label: osteogenesis imperfecta, type II, COL1A1-related, cattle
definition: Any osteogenesis imperfecta that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the COL1A1 gene.

label: skeletal dysplasia, FGF4-retrogene-related, dog
definition: Any skeletal dysplasia that occurs in dogs due to FGF4 retrogene insertions (FGF4L1 and/or FGF4L2).

label: Leigh syndrome, SURF1-related, pig
definition: A mitochondrial disease characterized by central nervous system development delay that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the SURF1 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: neuroaxonal dystrophy, VPS11-related, dog
definition: Any neuroaxonal dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the VPS11 gene.

label: neuroaxonal dystrophy, MFN2-related, dog
definition: Any neuroaxonal dystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the MFN2 gene.

label: hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer, MSH6-related, rhesus monkey
definition: Tumors at the ileocecal junction, cecum and proximal colon that occur in rhesus macaques due to a germline mutation in the MSH6 gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, NECAP1-related, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the NECAP1 gene.

label: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, MYH7-related, domestic cat
definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the MYH7 gene.

label: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, MYH7-related, pig
definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the MYH7 gene.

label: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, MYH7-related, rabbit
definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the MYH7 gene.

label: leukodystrophy, TSEN54-related, dog
definition: Leukodystrophy that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the TSEN54 gene.

label: hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, TAC3-related, domestic cat
definition: Hypogonadism characterized by dysfunctional GnRH release leading to low blood testosterone and pituitary hormone levels and impaired testicular function that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the TAC3 gene.

label: laryngeal paralysis, RAPGEF6-related, dog
definition: Laryngeal paralysis that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the RAPGEF6 gene.

label: lipid malabsorption, ACSL5-related, dog
definition: An inborn error of lipid metabolism characterized by stunted postnatal growth, steatorrhea, abdominal distension and wiry coat that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the ACSL5 gene.

label: hypotrichosis, HR-related, domestic cat
definition: Congenital hypotrichosis that occurs in cats due to a mutation in the HR gene.

label: hypotrichosis, HR-related, pig
definition: Congenital hypotrichosis that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the HR gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: hypotrichosis, HR-related, sheep
definition: Congenital hypotrichosis that occurs in sheep due to a mutation in the HR gene.

label: hypotrichosis, HEPHL1-related, cattle
definition: Congenital hypotrichosis that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the HEPHL1 gene.

label: congenital myopathy, SPTBN4-related, pig
definition: Any congenital myopathy that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the SPTBN4 gene.

label: split spinal cord malformation type I, cattle
definition: Any congenital duplication of the spinal cords where there is a bony partition separating the cords and each is contained in their own meningeal sheath.

label: split spinal cord malformation type II, cattle
definition: Any congenital duplication of the spinal cords where the spinal cords are merged and covered by the same meninges.

label: ichthyosis, ABCA12-related, pig
definition: Ichthyosis that occurs in pigs due to a mutation in the ABCA12 gene.

label: ichthyosis, ABCA12-related, cattle
definition: Ichthyosis that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the ABCA12 gene.

label: muscular dystrophy, ANO5-related, rabbit
definition: Any muscular dystrophy that occurs in rabbits due to a mutation in the ANO5 gene created by genetic engineering or gene editing.

label: ichthyosis, DSP-related, cattle
definition: Ichthyosis that occurs in cattle due to a mutation in the DSP gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, Miniature Schnauzer, dog
definition: Any progressive retinal atrophy that occurs in the Miniature Schnauzer breed of dog and is characterized by an average age of onset of seven years, mild clinical signs, and slow progression.

label: palmoplantar hyperkeratosis, DSG1-related, dog
definition: Any hyperkeratosis that occurs in dogs due to a mutation in the DSG1 gene.

label: progressive retinal atrophy, KIF3B-related, domestic cat
